Reading Guide¶

Each class or method, (private or pubblic), has it’s docstring, all’docstring starts with such form:

Constructor:

Class[‘var1’, ‘var2’, …]

How the method is called or the class is initialized properly.

‘var1’, ‘var2’, … are the class/method internal variable names on wich the input parameters are passed on.

Parameters :

var1[‘type(var1)’], var2[‘type(var2)’], …

type(var1), type(var2) are variables types. In order to correctly call or initialize the method or class types have to match

Class(‘var1’, ‘var2’, …) –> type(Class(‘var1’, ‘var2’, …))

Type returned by a proper call of the method or class initialization.
